meanings.definition: A person or thing that remains from a previous time or situation.
meanings.sent1: The old toys in the attic are holdovers from my childhood.
meanings.sent2: The holdovers from the party were the leftover snacks on the table.
meanings.sent3: The holdovers from the game night made the living room look like a toy store.
meanings.sent4: The dusty books on the shelf were holdovers from a forgotten era.
meanings.sent5: The holdovers in the museum showcased the history of the town.

meanings.definition: Remaining in a place or position.
meanings.sent1: The holdovers chairs in the waiting room were comfortable.
meanings.sent2: The holdovers students in the class were the ones who arrived early.
meanings.sent3: The holdovers plants in the garden added a touch of green to the landscape.
meanings.sent4: The holdovers clouds in the sky lingered long after the storm had passed.
meanings.sent5: The holdovers decorations in the room gave it a festive feel.

meanings.sent1: She decided to holdovers her favorite childhood toy.
meanings.sent2: The company chose to holdovers their original logo for brand recognition.
meanings.sent3: He would holdovers the memories of their adventures forever.
meanings.sent4: The decision to holdovers the old traditions was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: The artist wanted to holdovers the painting to complete it later.
